attributes.name: caret
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the button with a caret for use with dropdowns, popovers, etc.

attributes.name: circle
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a circle button.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the button.

attributes.name: expand
attributes.description:
Set to `"block"` for a full-width button or to `"full"` for a full-width button
without left and right borders.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the button in a loading state.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a pill-style button with rounded edges.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
The value is a space-separated list of [link types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types).

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The button's size.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the linked URL.
Special keywords: `"_blank"`, `"_self"`, `"_parent"`, `"_top"`.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the button.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The different variants.
The options are: `"default"`, `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"danger"`, and `"plain"`.

attributes.name: alignment
attributes.description: The checkbox's alignment.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the checkbox in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the checkbox.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the checkbox in an indeterminate state.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate this field is invalid. Will display the invalid text.

attributes.name: invalid-text
attributes.description: The radio group's invalid text. Alternatively, you can use the invalid-text slot.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The checkbox's value attribute.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description:
Forces the opening direction of the calendar modal to be always left or right.
This setting can be useful when the input is smaller than the opening date picker
would be as by default the picker always opens towards right.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Makes the date picker input component disabled. This prevents users from being able to
interact with the input, and conveys its inactive state to assistive technologies.

attributes.name: first-day-of-week
attributes.description:
Which day is considered first day of the week? `0` for Sunday, `1` for Monday, etc.
Default is Monday.

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description: The date picker's help text. Alternatively, you can use the help-text slot.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate this field is invalid. Will display the invalid text instead of the help text

attributes.name: invalid-text
attributes.description: The date picker's invalid text. Alternatively, you can use the invalid-text slot.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The date picker's label. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description:
Maximum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the min property.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description:
Minimum date allowed to be picked. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
This setting can be used alone or together with the max property.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the date picker input.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The date picker input's placeholder text.

attributes.name: required-indicator
attributes.description: Set to true to display a required indicator, adds an asterisk to label

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Date value. Must be in IS0-8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

attributes.name: close-on-select
attributes.description: Determines whether the dropdown should hide when a menu item is selected.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel away from its trigger.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the dropdown is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the dropdown panel. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the panel
inside of the viewport.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel along its trigger.

attributes.name: horizontal
attributes.description: Render the fields horizontal instead of vertical

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The field group label. Recommended for proper accessibility. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description:
Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.
Available options: `"off"`, `"none"`, `"on"`, `"sentences"`, `"words"`, `"characters"`.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Indicates whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: Whether auto correction should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text value.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Set to true to add a clear button when the input is populated.

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `gr-change` event after each keystroke. This also impacts form bindings such as `ngModel` or `v-model`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the input control.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which enter key to display.
Possible values: `"enter"`, `"done"`, `"go"`, `"next"`,
`"previous"`, `"search"`, and `"send"`.

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description: The input's help text. Alternatively, you can use the help-text slot.

attributes.name: hide-appearance
attributes.description: Set to true to hide input appearances.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: The input's inputmode attribute.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate this field is invalid. Will display the invalid text instead of the help text

attributes.name: invalid-text
attributes.description: The input's invalid text. Alternatively, you can use the invalid-text slot.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The inputs's label. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum value, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Specifies how many characters are allowed.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum value, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The input's name.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: Specifies a regular expression that the input value is checked against.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a pill-style input with rounded edges.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The input's placeholder text.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

attributes.name: required-indicator
attributes.description: Set to true to display a required indicator, adds an asterisk to label

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The input's size.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
Works with the min and max attributes to limit the increments at which a value can be set.
Possible values are: `"any"` or a positive floating point number.

attributes.name: toggle-password
attributes.description: Set to true to add a password toggle button for password inputs.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of control to display. The default type is text.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The input's value attribute.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the item in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the menu item in a disabled state.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: A unique value to store in the menu item. This can be used as a way to identify menu items when selected.

attributes.name: alignment
attributes.description: The radio's alignment attribute.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the radio in a checked state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the radio.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The radio's value attribute.

attributes.name: allow-empty-selection
attributes.description: If `true`, the radios can be deselected.

attributes.name: horizontal
attributes.description: Render the radios horizontal instead of vertical

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate this field is invalid. Will display the invalid text.

attributes.name: invalid-text
attributes.description: The radio group's invalid text. Alternatively, you can use the invalid-text slot.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The radio group label. Required for proper accessibility. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: required-indicator
attributes.description: Set to true to display a required indicator, adds an asterisk to label

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: the value of the radio group.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Set to true to add a clear button when the select is populated.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the select control.

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description: The select's help text. Alternatively, you can use the help-text slot.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate this field is invalid. Will display the invalid text instead of the help text

attributes.name: invalid-text
attributes.description: The select's invalid text. Alternatively, you can use the invalid-text slot.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The select's label. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: max-tags-visible
attributes.description:
The maximum number of tags to show when `multiple` is true. After the maximum, "+n" will be shown to indicate the
number of additional items that are selected. Set to -1 to remove the limit.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Set to true to enable multiselect.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The select's name.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a pill-style select with rounded edges.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The select's placeholder text.

attributes.name: required-indicator
attributes.description: Set to true to display a required indicator, adds an asterisk to label

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The select's size.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the control. This will be a string or an array depending on `multiple`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to draw the tab in a disabled state.

attributes.name: panel
attributes.description: The name of the tab panel the tab will control. The panel must be located in the same tab group.

attributes.name: route-navigation
attributes.description: Set to use a popstate eventlistner, to use route navigation.

attributes.name: tab-size
attributes.description: The tab's size.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Set to true to make the tag clearable.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Set to true to draw a pill-style tag with rounded edges.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The tag's size.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The tag's title.

attributes.name: truncate
attributes.description: Set to true to make the tag truncated.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The tag's type.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description:
Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.
Available options: `"off"`, `"none"`, `"on"`, `"sentences"`, `"words"`, `"characters"`.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: Whether auto correction should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text value.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `gr-change` event after each keystroke. This also impacts form bindings such as `ngModel` or `v-model`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable the textarea.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which enter key to display.
Possible values: `"enter"`, `"done"`, `"go"`, `"next"`,
`"previous"`, `"search"`, and `"send"`.

attributes.name: help-text
attributes.description: The textarea's help text. Alternatively, you can use the help-text slot.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: The textarea's inputmode attribute.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate this field is invalid. Will display the invalid text instead of the help text

attributes.name: invalid-text
attributes.description: The input's invalid text. Alternatively, you can use the invalid-text slot.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The textarea's label. Alternatively, you can use the label slot.

attributes.name: max-height
attributes.description: The number of max rows

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Specifies how many characters are allowed.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The textarea's name attribute.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The textarea's placeholder text.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

attributes.name: required-indicator
attributes.description: Set to true to display a required indicator, adds an asterisk to label

attributes.name: resize
attributes.description: Controls how the textarea can be resized.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: The number of rows to display by default.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The textarea's size.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The textarea's value attribute.
